summary: This document is an email chain from November 2021 between attorneys regarding the sharing of a defense motion and a subpoena in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. It shows legal coordination and confidentiality concerns between defense counsel, the government, and a third-party law firm.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell, coordinating with the government and other attorneys about sharing a confidential defense motion and subpoena.

persons.name: Brian Burns
persons.context: Attorney at Smith Villazor LLP requesting a copy of the defense motion from defense counsel.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney at Cohen & Gresser LLP who sent a signed subpoena to other counsel.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell, copied on the email about the subpoena.

persons.name: Bobbi Sternheim
persons.context: Defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell, copied on the email about the subpoena.

persons.name: Patrick Smit
persons.context: Recipient of the email from Christian Everdell regarding the subpoena.

connections.description: Pagliuca responds to Burns' request for a defense motion, explaining the need to defer to government confidentiality designations.
Everdell sends a signed subpoena to Smit, copying other defense counsel.
Both are defense attorneys for Ghislaine Maxwell, copied on the same legal correspondence.
Both are defense attorneys for Ghislaine Maxwell, listed together as counsel in the email.

events.title: Filing of Defense Motion
events.description: The defense files a motion seeking the issuance of a subpoena, referenced in the attached documents.

events.title: Subpoena Sent
events.description: Christian Everdell sends a signed subpoena to Patrick Smit and other defense counsel.

events.title: Request for Defense Motion
events.description: Brian Burns requests a copy of the defense motion from defense counsel, citing that they haven't seen it.

events.title: Coordination on Motion Sharing
events.description: Email chain shows coordination between defense and government regarding sharing an unredacted defense motion, with concerns about confidential designations.

locations: 250 West 55th Street, 30th Floor, New York, New York 10019
keyFacts: The defense filed a motion on November 14, 2021, seeking the issuance of a subpoena in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
All government productions in the case were designated confidential under a protective order, restricting the sharing of the defense motion.
Attorney Brian Burns, not part of the immediate defense team, requested a copy of the motion but had not seen it.
The email chain demonstrates the strict confidentiality protocols and coordination between defense counsel and the government in late 2021.
A signed subpoena was transmitted between attorneys on November 16, 2021, as part of the legal proceedings.
